options.title: --config-dir DIR
options.description: Instructs Subversion to read configuration information from the specified directory instead of the default location (.subversion in the user's home directory).

options.title: --config-option CONFSPEC
options.description: Sets, for the duration of the command, the value of a runtime configuration option. CONFSPEC is a string which specifies the configuration option namespace, name and value that you'd like to assign, formatted as FILE:SECTION:OPTION=[VALUE]. In this syntax, FILE and SECTION are the runtime configuration file (either config or servers) and the section thereof, respectively, which contain the option whose value you wish to change. OPTION is, of course, the option itself, and VALUE the value (if any) you wish to assign to the option. For example, to temporarily disable the use of the compression in the HTTP protocol, use --config-option=servers:global:http-compression=no. You can use this option multiple times to change multiple option values simultaneously.

options.title: --disable-locking
options.description: Causes svnsync to bypass its own exclusive access mechanisms and operate on the assumption that its exclusive access to the mirror repository is being guaranteed through some other, out-of-band mechanism.

options.title: --no-auth-cache
options.description: Prevents caching of authentication information (e.g., username and password) in the Subversion runtime configuration directories.

options.title: --non-interactive
options.description: In the case of an authentication failure or insufficient credentials, prevents prompting for credentials (e.g., username or password). This is useful if you're running Subversion inside an automated script and it's more appropriate to have Subversion fail than to prompt for more information.

options.title: --quiet (-q)
options.description: Requests that the client print only essential information while performing an operation.

options.title: --quiet (-q)
options.description: Requests that the client print only essential information while performing an operation.

options.title: --revision (-r) ARG
options.description: Used by svnsync copy-revprops to specify a particular revision or revision range on which to operate.

options.title: --revision (-r) ARG
options.description: Used by svnsync copy-revprops to specify a particular revision or revision range on which to operate.

options.title: --source-password PASSWD
options.description: Specifies the password for the Subversion server from which you are syncing. If not provided, or if incorrect, Subversion will prompt you for this information as needed.

options.title: --source-prop-encoding ARG
options.description: Instructs svnsync to assume that translatable Subversion revision properties found in the source repository are stored using the character encoding ARG and to transcode those into UTF-8 when copying them into the mirror repository.

options.title: --source-username NAME
options.description: Specifies the username for the Subversion server from which you are syncing. If not provided, or if incorrect, Subversion will prompt you for this information as needed.

options.title: --steal-lock
options.description: Causes svnsync to steal, as necessary, the lock which it uses on the mirror repository to ensure exclusive repository access. (This option should only be used when a lock exists in the mirror repository and is known to be staleâ€”that is, when you are certain that there are no other svnsync processes accessing that repository.)

options.title: --sync-password PASSWD
options.description: Specifies the password for the Subversion server to which you are syncing. If not provided, or if incorrect, Subversion will prompt you for this information as needed.

options.title: --sync-username NAME
options.description: Specifies the username for the Subversion server to which you are syncing. If not provided, or if incorrect, Subversion will prompt you for this information as needed.

options.title: --trust-server-cert
options.description: Used with --non-interactive to accept any unknown SSL server certificates without prompting.

options.description: Specifies the username for the Subversion server to which you are syncing. If not provided, or if incorrect, Subversion will prompt you for this information as needed.

options.title: --trust-server-cert
options.description: Used with --non-interactive to accept any unknown SSL server certificates without prompting.

options.title: --allow-non-empty
options.description: Disables the verification (which svnsync initialize performs by default) that the repository being initialized is empty of history version.
